title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Reynaldo Hutabarat F (2025). senimuse: R API wrapper museum collections. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/farhanreynaldo/senimuse.
code: @Manual{,   title = {senimuse: R API wrapper for museum collections},   author = {Farhan {Reynaldo Hutabarat}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/farhanreynaldo/senimuse}, }

what: R API wrapper for museum collections
title: R API wrapper for museum collections
text: goal senimuse provide R interface museum API, allowing users easily access analyze artwork data collection. package simplifies process retrieving information artworks, artists, exhibitions museum resources data analysis, visualization, research purposes.

title: R API wrapper for museum collections
text: can install development version senimuse GitHub :

title: R API wrapper for museum collections
text: example retrieve artwork information museum collection using senimuse:
code: library(senimuse) get_artworks(4, fields = c("id", "title", "date_start", "date_end")) #>   id          title date_start date_end #> 1  4 Priest and Boy       1865     1880

what: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
text: Fetches complete list galleries Art Institute Chicago's public API, automatically handling pagination return available records. function implements rate limiting comply API best practices.

title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
text: tibble (data frame) row represents one gallery, containing   available fields provided API.

title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
text: Art Institute Chicago API documentation: https://api.artic.edu/docs

title: Retrieve Gallery Information from the Art Institute of Chicago API — galleries
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get all galleries gallery_data <- galleries() } # }

what: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: Fetches artwork information various museum public APIs using object IDs optionally specifies fields return.

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: object_ids vector artwork object IDs (numeric character). identifiers correspond unique IDs used museum's collection. NULL. museum character string indicating museum query. Currently supports: "artic" - Art Institute Chicago "met" - Metropolitan Museum Art fields optional vector field names (character) return artwork. NULL (default), returns available fields.

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: tibble (data frame) row represents one artwork columns   contain requested fields. structure varies depending requested fields   museum API.

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
text: Art Institute Chicago API: https://api.artic.edu/docs/ Metropolitan Museum Art API: https://metmuseum.github.io/

title: Retrieve Artwork Data from Museum APIs — get_artworks
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get artwork from Art Institute of Chicago get_artworks(4, museum = "artic")  # Get artwork from Metropolitan Museum of Art get_artworks(436535, museum = "met")  # Get multiple artworks with specific fields get_artworks(c(27992, 28560), museum = "artic",              fields = c("title", "artist_display", "date_display")) } # }

what: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: Searches artworks museum collections based query string returns artwork data matching items.

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: query character string containing search query. NULL. Spaces automatically converted hyphens. museum character string indicating museum query. Currently supports: "artic" - Art Institute Chicago "met" - Metropolitan Museum Art fields optional vector field names (character) return artwork. NULL (default), returns available fields. size maximum number results return. Defaults 10.

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: tibble (data frame) row represents one artwork matching search   criteria columns contain requested fields.

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
text: Art Institute Chicago API: https://api.artic.edu/docs/ Metropolitan Museum Art API: https://metmuseum.github.io/

title: Search for Artworks from Museum APIs — search_artworks
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Search for artworks related to "sunflowers" in Art Institute of Chicago search_artworks("sunflowers", museum = "artic")  # Search Met Museum with specific fields to return search_artworks("monet", museum = "met", fields = c("title", "artistDisplayName", "objectDate"))  # Search with a larger result set search_artworks("landscape", museum = "artic", size = 25) } # }
